questions.question: Why is proofreading essential for advanced writers?
answers: To eliminate errors and refine text quality.
questions.correct: To eliminate errors and refine text quality.

questions.question: What is a common focus during editing?
Why review text for redundancy?
answers: To remove repetition and make text concise.
questions.correct: To remove repetition and make text concise.

questions.question: Why is focusing on transitions vital?
answers: To ensure seamless connections between ideas.
To skip making connections between paragraphs.
questions.correct: To ensure seamless connections between ideas.

questions.question: Why review word choice during editing?
answers: To select words that best capture tone and precision.
To skip finding the best words for context.
To remove the writer’s voice intentionally.
questions.correct: To select words that best capture tone and precision.

questions.question: What is an important part of proofreading?
answers: Correcting spelling, grammar, and punctuation errors.
questions.correct: Correcting spelling, grammar, and punctuation errors.

questions.question: Why review tone and voice?
answers: To ensure the text suits its intended audience.
questions.correct: To ensure the text suits its intended audience.

questions.question: Why review structure when editing?
answers: To make sure ideas flow logically and clearly.
To focus only on word count.
questions.correct: To make sure ideas flow logically and clearly.

questions.question: Why review length and conciseness?
answers: To remove filler and stay focused on key ideas.
To skip making edits for clarity.
questions.correct: To remove filler and stay focused on key ideas.

questions.question: What is the benefit of reading aloud?
answers: To spot errors and inconsistencies more easily.
To skip focusing on sound and flow.
To avoid making edits for precision.
questions.correct: To spot errors and inconsistencies more easily.

questions.question: Why review formatting and structure?
answers: To skip making text visually organized.

questions.question: Why review passive voice usage?
answers: To ensure clarity and directness when needed.
To remove all forms of voice.
questions.correct: To ensure clarity and directness when needed.

questions.question: Why review verb tenses and agreement?
answers: To maintain grammatical consistency and precision.
questions.correct: To maintain grammatical consistency and precision.

questions.question: Why is editing vital for advanced writers?
answers: It improves clarity, precision, and professionalism.
questions.correct: It improves clarity, precision, and professionalism.
